details.description: You must apply to Natural England for a licence to release non-native species into the wild
details.body:
You must apply to Natural England for a licence to release non-native species into the wild.

You can get an application form from Natural England.

You must have a licence to release or grow in the wild an animal or plant that’s listed in the list of prohibited species in Schedule 9 of the Wildlife and Countryside Act 1981.

Download ‘List of prohibited species’ (PDF, 89KB)

You can search for information on non-native species on the Non-native species secretariat website.

details.description: Includes right of way, protecting landscapes and animal welfare

details.description: Bringing animals, plants or food into the UK - pet passports, plant health certificates, the rules around meat, dairy and fish products
Farmers and rural landowners must help protect the rural landscape - available funding, cross compliance, hedgerows, watercourses, woodland, stone walls, monuments
